document.title: The nonlinear Schrödinger equation is Hamiltonian

Math.text: H * u = integral@((1 / 2) * (absolute-value@(nabla@(u))) ^ 2) + ((2 * mu) / (p + 1)) * (absolute-value@(u)) ^ (p + 1) * d * x

H * (u + epsilon * v) = integral@((1 / 2) * nabla@(u + epsilon * v) * nabla@(overline@(u) + epsilon * overline@(v))) + ((2 * mu) / (p + 1)) * (u + epsilon * v) ^ ((p + 1) / 2) * (overline@(u) + epsilon * overline@(v)) ^ ((p + 1) / 2)

para.p:
We have, for
∈ v
T u
,

Math.text: d * H * u * v = evaluated-at@(d / (d * epsilon), epsilon = 0) * H * (u + epsilon * v) = integral@((1 / 2) * (nabla@(v) * nabla@(overline@(u)) + nabla@(u) * nabla@(overline@(v)))) + ((2 * mu) / (p + 1)) * (((p + 1) / 2) * u ^ ((p - 1) / 2) * v * (overline@(u)) ^ ((p + 1) / 2) + ((p + 1) / 2) * u ^ ((p + 1) / 2) * (overline@(u)) ^ ((p - 1) / 2) * overline@(v)) * d * x = real-part * integral@(nabla@(overline@(v)) * nabla@(u)) + 2 * mu * (absolute-value@(u)) ^ (p - 1) * u * overline@(v) * d * x = real-part * integral@(((- Delta * u) + 2 * mu * (absolute-value@(u)) ^ (p - 1) * u) * overline@(v) * differential-d@(x))
evaluated-at@(d / (d * epsilon), epsilon = 0) * H * (u + epsilon * v)
real-part * integral@(nabla@(overline@(v)) * nabla@(u)) + 2 * mu * (absolute-value@(u)) ^ (p - 1) * u * overline@(v) * d * x
real-part * integral@(((- Delta * u) + 2 * mu * (absolute-value@(u)) ^ (p - 1) * u) * overline@(v) * differential-d@(x))
omega * open-interval@(v _ 1, v _ 2) = - 2 * imaginary-part * integral@(v _ 1 * overline@(v _ 2) * differential-d@(x))

para.p:
The Hamiltonian vector field
X H
of
H
is defined, for
∈ v
T u
, by

Math.text: omega * open-interval@(X _ H * u, v) = d * H * u * v

para.p:
Therefore we have for
∈ v
T u
that

Math.text: - 2 * imaginary-part * integral@(X _ H * u * overline@(v) * differential-d@(x)) = real-part * integral@(((- Delta * u) + 2 * mu * (absolute-value@(u)) ^ (p - 1) * u) * overline@(v) * differential-d@(x)) = imaginary-part * integral@(((- i * Delta * u) + 2 * i * mu * (absolute-value@(u)) ^ (p - 1) * u) * overline@(v) * differential-d@(x))
- 2 * imaginary-part * integral@(X _ H * u * overline@(v) * differential-d@(x))
real-part * integral@(((- Delta * u) + 2 * mu * (absolute-value@(u)) ^ (p - 1) * u) * overline@(v) * differential-d@(x))
imaginary-part * integral@(((- i * Delta * u) + 2 * i * mu * (absolute-value@(u)) ^ (p - 1) * u) * overline@(v) * differential-d@(x))
- 2 * X _ H * u = (- i * Delta * u) + 2 * i * mu * (absolute-value@(u)) ^ (p - 1) * u
X _ H * u = (i / 2) * Delta * u - i * mu * (absolute-value@(u)) ^ (p - 1) * u

para.p:
The flow
⁢ S
( t )
of the Hamiltonian vector field
X H
satisfies, for any
u 0
and for
=
⁢ u
( t )
⁢ S
( t )
u 0
,

Math.text: u _ t * t = X _ H * u * t = (i / 2) * Delta * u * t - i * mu * (absolute-value@(u * t)) ^ (p - 1) * u * t

para.p: This equation can be written as

Math.text: i * u _ t * t + (1 / 2) * Delta * u * t = mu * (absolute-value@(u * t)) ^ (p - 1) * u * t
